channel.title: Amazing Podcast Episodes: ~2x curated episodes per week
channel.description: Curating & reposting the ~2 best podcasts per week. There are simply too many good podcasts out there, let us pick the best two each week for you. Copyright is owned by the publisher, not this podcast, audio is streamed directly from publisher's servers.

channel.itunes:author: Amazing Podcasts

itunes:owner.itunes:name: Amazing Podcast Episodes: ~2x curated episodes per week

item.title: Invisibilia: The Secret History of Thoughts
item.description: In "The Secret History of Thoughts," co-hosts Alix Spiegel and Lulu Miller ask the question, "Are my thoughts related to my inner wishes, do they reveal who I really am?" The answer can have profound consequences for your life.
item.itunes:author: NPR
item.itunes:subtitle: In "The Secret History of Thoughts," co-hosts Alix Spiegel and Lulu Miller ask the question, "Are my thoughts related to my inner wishes, do they reveal who I really am?" The answer can have profound consequences for your life.
item.itunes:summary: In "The Secret History of Thoughts," co-hosts Alix Spiegel and Lulu Miller ask the question, "Are my thoughts related to my inner wishes, do they reveal who I really am?" The answer can have profound consequences for your life.

item.title: Freakonomics Radio: Are You Ready for a Glorious Sunset?
item.description: The gist: we spend billions on end-of-life healthcare that doesn’t do much good. So what if a patient could forego the standard treatment and get a cash rebate instead?
item.itunes:author: Freakonomics Radio
item.itunes:subtitle: The gist: we spend billions on end-of-life healthcare that doesn’t do much good. So what if a patient could forego the standard treatment and get a cash rebate instead?
item.itunes:summary: The gist: we spend billions on end-of-life healthcare that doesn’t do much good. So what if a patient could forego the standard treatment and get a cash rebate instead?

item.title: The Tim Ferriss Show: The Interview Master: Cal Fussman and the Power of Listening
item.description: This episode is very special to me and features a verbal Jedi who never gets interviewed himself: Cal Fussman.
item.itunes:author: Tim Ferriss: Bestselling Author, Human Guinea Pig
item.itunes:subtitle: This episode is very special to me and features a verbal Jedi who never gets interviewed himself: Cal Fussman.
item.itunes:summary: This episode is very special to me and features a verbal Jedi who never gets interviewed himself: Cal Fussman.

item.title: The Ezra Klein Show: Bill Gates on stopping climate change, building robots, and the best books he’s read
item.description: Bill Gates is one of those people for whom “needs no introduction” is actually true. The polymathic Microsoft founder now leads the world’s largest and most important private foundation, and he’s predicting that we’re on the cusp of the energy breakthrough that’s going to save the world. He also talks about the controversial idea that technological innovation is slowing down, assesses how close we are to true artificial intelligence, and explains why you really want to save being sick for 20 years from now.
item.itunes:author: Vox / Panoply
item.itunes:subtitle: Bill Gates on stopping climate change, building robots, and the best books he's read
